Name.creator: Gill, Eric, 1882-1940
Rights.servicesContact: William Andrews Clark Memorial Library, UCLA, Phone: (310) 794-5155, Email: clark@humnet.ucla.edu
Description.note: Setting out for inscription on pier in Church at Upton in Severn (scale: 1”=1’): pencil finished drawing, color washed, with scale annotations by artist indicating 9’6” height for 3’6” base. Inscription (31 lines) begins, “This window was erected by his friends in memory of George Edward Martin of Ham. Court… born 11 Nov. 1829 died 12 Feb. 1905…” Gill Journal, Job 169 (1906) indicated this may have been drawing # 1 of a series (& this one not executed) for Mrs. Martin.
Title: Eric Gill II

Name.creator: Gill, Eric, 1882-1940
Rights.servicesContact: William Andrews Clark Memorial Library, UCLA, Phone: (310) 794-5155, Email: clark@humnet.ucla.edu
Description.note: Part of a complete collection of 25 drawings made by Gill. He was commissioned to carve 10 panels symbolizing civilizations which most affected the history of Palestine (see Jerusalem Diary postscript in Gill Bibl. P.205). Although the carvings were reproduced in Jerusalem Diary (1953), these drawings were never published. Source: G.F. Sims, March 1962. This drawing is sketch for carving, with the text: “THE FOUNDATION STONE OF THIS BUILDING WAS LAID BY LIEUTENANT-COLONEL SIR JOHN CHANCELLOR G.C.M.G., G.C.V.O., D.S.O. HIS BRITANNIC MAGESTY’S HIGH COMMISSIONER AND COMMANDER IN CHIFF FOR PALESTINE ON THE 19TH DAY OF JUNE IN THE YEAR OF OUR LORD MCMXX.”
Title: Untitled [Palestine Drawings]

Name.creator: Gill, Eric, 1882-1940
Rights.servicesContact: William Andrews Clark Memorial Library, UCLA, Phone: (310) 794-5155, Email: clark@humnet.ucla.edu
Description.note: Part of a complete collection of 25 drawings made by Gill. He was commissioned to carve 10 panels symbolizing civilizations which most affected the history of Palestine (see Jerusalem Diary postscript in Gill Bibl. P.205). Although the carvings were reproduced in Jerusalem Diary (1953), these drawings were never published. Source: G.F. Sims, March 1962. This drawing shows a man riding a winged horse. Numbered, “9.”
Title: Islam brought the Koran [Palestine Drawings]

Description.note: Proof for Stephen Pepler bookplate. Depicts a wreath surrounding a smock with stone shapes floating in front of it. Description.note: Proof of woodblock print of St. Dominic holding a book, attached to grey paper. The proof bears the name ‘Chute,’ most likely referring to Desmond Chute, who worked with Gill at the time and may have executed the proof. Originally filed with R.A. Walker correspondence collection. DR-11G
Title: Untitled

Description.note: Gilliana. Text of poster reads, “Master of Line: The Letter Forms of Eric Gill’ / Illustrated Public Lecture by James Mosley of the St. Bride Printing Library, London / Wednesday, 18th April 7:00 p.m. / 101 McCormick Hall / Reception to follow / Sponsored by the Graphic Arts Collection.” Poster includes image of “Venus and Cupid and the Golden Cockrell.” Originally housed in drawing 14G.
Title: Master of Line: The Letter Forms of Eric Gill
